intro: Stenogyne kilaueae, commonly known as the Kilauea mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Stenogyne kilaueae is considered an endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species competition.
